coggame
Class GameApplication

java.lang.Object
  coggame.GameApplication

public abstract class GameApplication
extends java.lang.Object

GameApplication is an abstract class that deals with much of the boilerplate logic required for creating a raster-graphics game in Java, including double-buffering, timing, fullscreen functionality, upscaling and buffered key input.

Constructor Detail

GameApplication

public GameApplication(int width,
                       int height,
                       int scaleFactor,
                       boolean fullscreen)
Construct a new GameApplication. The width and height given here are the number of pixels in the drawing buffer that will be passed to painting logic. The scaling factor indicates how many times this buffer should be scaled up for the actual game window or fullscreen resolution. For example, a GameApplication with width 320, height 240 and scaleFactor 2 will have a 640x480 window.

Parameters:
width - the width of the graphics buffer in pixels
height - the height of the graphics buffer in pixels
scaleFactor - see above
fullscreen - should this application launch in fullscreen mode?
Method Detail

getWindow

public javax.swing.JFrame getWindow()
Return the JFrame for this application. mess with it at your own peril.

getKeys

public int getKeys()
Return a bitvector containing status bits corresponding to the static key constants. For example, if you wanted to check that the fire key was pressed, you could do the following: 
if ((getKeys() & FIRE) != 0) { ... }

keyPressed

protected void keyPressed(int key)
Called whenever a keyboard key is depressed. Values returned correspond to the constants exposed in java.awt.event.KeyEvent. If the Escape key is pressed, the game will immediately quit as from a call to exit().

Parameters:
key - the keycode of the depressed key

keyReleased

protected void keyReleased(int key)
Called whenever a keyboard key is released. Values returned correspond to the constants exposed in java.awt.event.KeyEvent.

Parameters:
key - the keycode of the released key

keyTyped

protected void keyTyped(char c)
Called whenever a keyboard key mapped to a displayable character is pressed and released.

Parameters:
c - the character represented by the key

init

protected void init()
The init method will be called before game event pumps are initialized, and is the safe place to do any setup before the first frame of the game is rendered.

paint

public abstract void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
A game's rendering code should go here.

Parameters:
g - the destination Graphics surface.

tick

public abstract void tick(double time)
A game's logic should go here.

Parameters:
time - the number of seconds since the last tick() call

loadImage

public static java.awt.Image loadImage(java.lang.String filename)
A convenience method for loading image files from this application's JAR. Blocks until the image is fully loaded.

Parameters:
filename - the filename of the image resource
